item.title: Introduction
item.description: Sleep is just as important for your health as eating or exercising well. But people often forget this, or feel like they can’t “control” sleep.

item.title: Why sleep is magic
item.description: Compared to other animals, we sleep for quite a long time, and deeply. A rabbit only sleeps in short bursts and is very easy to wake up.

item.title: The before-sleep phase
item.description: A good start is half the battle. Sleep doesn’t start the moment you hit the pillow, it starts way before that.

item.title: The sleep phase
item.description: You obviously can’t control much while sleeping. That’s the point. You’re completely calm, at rest, letting your subconscious do its job.

item.title: The after-sleep phase
item.description: Hopefully, the tips so far help you fall asleep faster, and stay asleep. That’s great! As it means you get good quality sleep, which was the goal of this course.

item.title: Sleep schedule
item.description: This will be a short chapter, as this knowledge is simple and commonly known. It’s good to have a schedule.

item.title: Science & Facts
item.description: I’ve explained the benefits of sleep mostly from a general, intuitive point of view. And using examples. In this chapter, I want to quickly give some more concrete advantages and properties of sleep.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: Let’s recap. I taught you that sleep is crucial. You break down your body and brain during the day—sleep is needed to rebuild.
